meanings.definition: A person who slogs or works hard and steadily.
meanings.sent1: The dedicated slogger spent hours in the field, planting seeds.
meanings.sent2: The slogger completed all the tasks on the list diligently.
meanings.sent3: The slogger's determination to finish the project was truly admirable.
meanings.sent4: She was a slogger in the kitchen, preparing meals for the whole family.
meanings.sent5: The young slogger never gave up, even when faced with challenges.

meanings.definition: To walk or move with slow, heavy steps.
meanings.sent1: The tired hiker sloggered up the steep mountain trail.
meanings.sent2: She sloggered through the thick mud, trying to reach the other side.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy cat sloggered lazily across the room, looking for a cozy spot.
meanings.sent4: The old car sloggered along the bumpy road, struggling to keep up.
meanings.sent5: The exhausted runner sloggered to the finish line, determined to complete the race.

meanings.definition: To hit or strike heavily and clumsily.
meanings.sent1: He sloggered the hammer down on the nail, trying to fix the loose board.
meanings.sent2: The boxer sloggered his opponent with a powerful punch.
meanings.sent3: The chef sloggered the knife on the cutting board, chopping vegetables for the soup.
meanings.sent4: The toddler sloggered the toy against the floor, making a loud noise.
meanings.sent5: The worker sloggered the shovel into the ground, digging a deep hole for the tree.
